desc: Dr. Dennis Renshaw was born in Brownsville, Tennessee, but grew up in Iran, India and Indonesia as his father was with the United States State Department. At age 15, he climbed Mt. Damavand, Iran, elevation 18,406 feet, the highest mountain in Iran and the highest volcano in Asia. It’s snow-covered year-round.

layout.text: Come share my adventures, challenges, dangers, and resolve as I hiked the 2,186 mile Appalachian Trail.
